    • Method Detail

      • leader

        public GroupMember leader()
        Returns the current group leader.

        The returned leader is the last known leader for the group. The leader is associated with the current term() which is guaranteed to be unique and monotonically increasing. All resource instances are guaranteed to see leader changes in the same order. If a leader leaves the group, it is guaranteed that all open resource instances are notified of the change in leadership prior to the leave operation being completed. This guarantee is maintained only as long as the resource's session remains open.

        The leader is not guaranteed to be consistent across the cluster at any given point in time. For example, a long garbage collection pause can result in the resource's session expiring and the resource failing to increment the leader at the appropriate time. Users should use the term() for fencing when interacting with external systems.

        Returns:
        The current group leader.

      • term

        public long term()
        Returns the current group term.

        The term is a globally unique, monotonically increasing token that represents an epoch. All resource instances are guaranteed to see term changes in the same order. If a leader leaves the group, it is guaranteed that the term will be incremented and all open resource instances are notified of the term change prior to the leave operation being completed. However, this guarantee is maintained only as long as the resource's session remains open.

        For any given term, the group guarantees that a single leader() will be elected and any leader elected after the leader for this term will be associated with a higher term.

        The term is not guaranteed to be unique across the cluster at any given point in time. For example, a long garbage collection pause can result in the resource's session expiring and the resource failing to increment the term at the appropriate time. Users should use the term for fencing when interacting with external systems.

        Returns:
        The current group term.

      • onTerm

        public Listener<Long> onTerm(Consumer<Long> callback)
        Registers a callback to be called when the term changes.

        The provided callback will be called when a term change notification is received by the resource. The returned Listener can be used to unregister the term listener via Listener.close().

        Parameters:
        callback - The callback to be called when the term changes.
        Returns:
        The term listener.

      • onElection

        public Listener<GroupMember> onElection(Consumer<GroupMember> callback)
        Registers a callback to be called when a member of the group is elected leader.

        The provided callback will be called when notification of a leader change is received by the resource. The returned Listener can be used to unregister the term listener via Listener.close().

        Parameters:
        callback - The callback to call when a member of the group is elected leader.
        Returns:
        The leader election listener.
